when are you going to make me one????  Let me know the cost, tks.  sf
 
 
I=
n a message dated 8/21/2010 3:39:55 P.M. Eastern Standard Time,  
purpleali=
engirl@... writes:

 
 
 
I make the triangle sweep adjustable so I c=
an cover the entire AM  or FM 
band. Some tuners have different sweep requi=
rements for each band, so  
sometimes have to add a pot to adjust the max l=
evel for one of the bands.  AM=3D530 
to 1710 Khz and FM 88.5 to 108mhz, bu=
t you don't have to cover the  entire 
band, all that is required is enough=
 to provide the raw audio bits the  
entities use to make their voices. 
 
=
 A Danish researcher back in the 80s was just "wobbling" between a  couple =

stations to make contact. His name was Stein and there's more info on  the=
 
German VTF site. Stein also has his sweep circuit there. 
 
 The best sou=
nding systems seem to be the way Steve Hultay makes  his, by 
adding sweep =
to a complete radio. see _keyportparanormal.com_ 
(http://keyportparanormal=
.com/) . I take the  tuners out of the radio, and supply my own 
amplifier =
and sweep. At present I'm  making a box using a Timex clock radio 
tuner, t=
he triangle sweep, and computer  sound amplifier and speaker system 
for th=
e bass response. I just started  this project yesterday. I use Timex 
model=
 T309T AM/FM/nature sounds clock  radios when I can find them in thrift 
st=
ores cheap. I found a Timex model  T313T this morning, and hoping it has th=
e 
seperate tuner board inside, as the  300 series has so far. 
 
 I used t=
o use car stereo tuner modules, but those tend to be too  noisy. 
Box 13, t=
hat Hultay just got back is based on a car tuner. He did a  YouTube 
video =
of it.
 
 I'm still pretty much an amateur at this, there are so many  vari=
ables. 
 
 Frank-S
 
On Fri, Aug 20, 2010 at 6:35 PM, Luis <_luispucp098@ya=
hoo.com_ 
(mailto:luispucp098@...) >  wrote:


 
 
 
I am very glad f=
or your atention Frank , i will make a box and i need it  
be very good , f=

results take =
origin by materials , not much the dimensions , isnt it? .  
Another import=
ant question , what is the range of frecuencies of the  triangle 
wave ? I =
know about the model of radio determine that , but what is  the 
common ran=
ge ? ... hz? , khz? ...

yahoogroups.com) , Frank 
Sumption  <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>

> Alumi=
num seems to work the best. I got a voice that  sounded like Raudive
> sayi=
ng copper. I have used plastic and wood.  Different materials seem to
> all=
ow different levels, but it's hard to  tell for sure who/what is 
talking.
=
> 
> Folding the tube seems  to make it act like a larger tube. With just a=
 
long
> straight tube  the sound tends to be tinny. I made a chamber 12 in=
ches 
square
> and 4  feet long from MDF board lined with aluminum foil yea=
rs ago, the
>  voices were almost demonic sounding, so I took it apart.
> 
=
>  The only difference with the hacked radio is the sweep. With the hack  
=
radio
> the sweep steps so the radio is tuned in 10khz increments.  With th=
e box 
it's
> a continuous sweep, linear uses a triangle  wave.
> 
> F-S

 effect is  like a mechanical sound filter. The

 the lower tyhe effected frequencies. I use tubing so it 
can  be

e smaller to fit inside a cabinet. I don't even  measure anything 
when

 I

using.

ems to  add
